intro: Perideridia americana, commonly known as American meadow cranesbill, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its upright stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Perideridia americana thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
